it.emarolab.amor.owlDebugger

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.emarolab.amor.owlDebugger.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps in file management.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileManager

        public FileManager(java.lang.String path,
                   java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String format)
        Create and initialized a file manager. In particular the following rules are true for this method: 
         if 'path' is equal to "default" it builds path 
        with the last folder with prefix: dd-mm-yyyy_hhAM-mm_
 if 'fileName' is equal to "default" it builds file 
        with name with prefix: dd-mm-yyyy_hhAM-mm_
 if 'format' is equal to "default" than 
        'path' is the complete absolute path to the file and 
        'fileName is unconsidered
        This method uses the default base path, which is equal to: System.getProperty("user.dir") + "/files/logs/"
        Parameters:
        path - the relative directory where the file is.
        fileName - the name of the file.
        format - the extension of the file.

      • FileManager

        public FileManager(java.lang.String path,
                   java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String format,
                   java.lang.String basedPath)
        It create a new file manager following the same rules as FileManager(String, String, String). Only different is that this constructor does not use the default base path anymore.
        Parameters:
        path - the relative directory where the file is.
        fileName - the name of the file.
        format - the extension of the file.
        basedPath - the path which define the relative directory.

    • Method Detail

      • loadFile

        public boolean loadFile()
        After class construction, when paths are setted a file must be open before use it. If the file does not exist this method will create it.
        Returns:
        true if the file has been loaded or false if not.

      • closeFile

        public boolean closeFile()
        After manipulation the file mast be close to properly create it and make it readable by text editors.
        Returns:
        true if the file has been closed, false otherwise

      • printOnFile

        public boolean printOnFile(java.util.List<java.lang.String> strs,
                           boolean overwrite)
        Write all the strings into a file with a new line as separator. If the flag is true than the file is cleaned first, otherwise the text will be appended to the already existing file, if any. It automatically open, print and then close the file.
        Parameters:
        strs - strings to be written into the file
        overwrite - flag. If false those strings will be appended to the file, otherwise the file will be cleaned first.
        Returns:
        true if all the strings have been printed in the file, false otherwise.

      • printOnFile

        public boolean printOnFile(java.util.List<java.lang.String> strs)
        Append all the string into the file, which should be already opened.
        Parameters:
        strs - strings to be written into the file
        Returns:
        true if all the strings have been printed in the file, false otherwise.

      • deleteFile

        public boolean deleteFile()
        Delete the file.
        Returns:
        true if the operation ends successfully, false otherwise.

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Returns:
        the directory to the file.

      • getPossibleFormat

        public java.lang.String[] getPossibleFormat()
        Returns:
        all the possible extension that can be used by this manager.

      • getFormatFromAbsolutePath

        public java.lang.String getFormatFromAbsolutePath(java.lang.String absolutePath)
        It assume to have path which contains only one symbol equal to "." and based in this it retrieve the extension of a file from its coplete path.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath - full directory path to file
        Returns:
        the format of the file
